Permutation-Based Interaction Test with Mandatory Bootstrapped Inference

Source: R/perm_diff_interaction.R
perm_diff_interaction.Rd

Performs a permutation test (optional) for interaction effects between conditions across ancestries. Always estimates bootstrapped standard errors and confidence intervals for the observed interaction effects via resampling within ancestries.

Usage

perm_diff_interaction(
  X,
  Y,
  MX,
  MY,
  g_col,
  a_col,
  seed = NULL,
  B = 1000,
  permute = TRUE,
  min_iter = 500,
  max_iter = 10000,
  tol = 0.001,
  batch_size = 100,
  check_convergence = TRUE
)

Arguments

X

A numeric matrix of expression values for ancestry A (rows = samples, columns = genes).

Y

A numeric matrix of expression values for ancestry B (same format as X).

MX

A data.frame of metadata for X, must include columns for group and ancestry.

MY

A data.frame of metadata for Y, must include columns for group and ancestry.

g_col

Column name in metadata indicating condition/group (factor with 2 levels).

a_col

Column name in metadata indicating ancestry (must be unique per ancestry).

seed

Optional integer to set random seed for reproducibility.

B

Integer. Number of permutations and bootstraps to perform. Set to NULL for adaptive convergence.

permute

Logical. Whether to perform permutation-based interaction testing.

min_iter

Minimum number of permutations/bootstraps to run before checking convergence.

max_iter

Maximum number of permutations/bootstraps allowed.

tol

Tolerance threshold for convergence (applies to empirical p-values and bootstrap SEs).

batch_size

Number of permutations/bootstraps to add per iteration.

check_convergence

Logical. Whether to check convergence in fixed-B mode (if permute = TRUE).

Value

A list with:

summary_stats

A data.frame with gene-wise observed statistics (T_obs), bootstrapped standard errors (SE), 95% confidence intervals (CI_lower, CI_upper), empirical p-values (p_value, NA if permute = FALSE), and Benjamini-Hochberg adjusted p-values (p_adj, NA if permute = FALSE).

T_perm

Matrix of permutation-based test statistics (or NULL if permute = FALSE).

T_boot

Matrix of bootstrap-based observed statistics (rows = bootstraps, columns = genes).

B_used_perm

Number of valid permutations used (or NA if permute = FALSE).

B_used_boot

Number of valid bootstrap replicates used.

converged_perm

Logical indicating if permutation p-values converged (or NA if permute = FALSE).

converged_boot

Logical indicating if bootstrap SEs converged.

Details

Permutation testing can be toggled using the `permute` flag. When `permute = FALSE`, only bootstrapped confidence intervals and standard errors are provided, and p-values are returned as NA.

The input expression matrices must have samples as rows and genes as columns.
